body_html:
ah that was my bad. I git-cloned @yongtang's repository and then forgot to switch the branch.
The logging works (great stuff @yongtang 👍) and the error was
The authorization header is malformed; the region 'us-east-1' is wrong; expecting 'eu-west-1'

The fix that worked for me was to explicitly do an export AWS_REGION=eu-west-1.

However the region set in my ~/.aws/config was already 'eu-west-1' so there seems to be an error that this value wasn't taken by default (or it was overwritten later on when the request was made).

The logging works (great stuff @yongtang 👍) and the error was
The authorization header is malformed; the region 'us-east-1' is wrong; expecting 'eu-west-1'
The fix that worked for me was to explicitly do an export AWS_REGION=eu-west-1.
However the region set in my ~/.aws/config was already 'eu-west-1' so there seems to be an error that this value wasn't taken by default (or it was overwritten later on when the request was made).
body:
ah that was my bad. I git-cloned @yongtang's repository and then forgot to switch the branch.
The logging works (great stuff @yongtang 👍) and the error was 
`The authorization header is malformed; the region 'us-east-1' is wrong; expecting 'eu-west-1'`

The fix that worked for me was to explicitly do an `export AWS_REGION=eu-west-1`.

However the region set in my ~/.aws/config was already 'eu-west-1' so there seems to be an error that this value wasn't taken by default (or it was overwritten later on when the request was made).
